| A Punisher:* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is neither male nor female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* does not naturally [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") HP.
* [does not move](/wiki/Sessile "Sessile"). |                                                                 |

The **Punisher** is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"). Punishers are the only members of the "statue" [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), \`, which uses the same glyph as ordinary [statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue") and [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder").

Punishers are stationary, but can cast powerful [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") from a unique spell set that contains a selection of mage and clerical spells, with weighting to avoid repeated casting of [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties")[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Punishers can also cast a unique melee-range spell that attaches an [iron ball](/wiki/Iron_ball "Iron ball") to the player as with a [scroll of punishment](/wiki/Scroll_of_punishment "Scroll of punishment"). [\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) A Punisher possesses all forms of elemental [resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance"), except for [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [4 References](#References)

## Generation

Punishers only appear in [Sheol](/wiki/Sheol "Sheol"): upon level creation for each non-fixed floor in the branch, there is a 1⁄2 chance of a Punisher being created. A Punisher can also be created by reading a cursed or uncursed scroll of punishment while confused.

A Punisher will always generate as hostile, and is not a valid form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

## Strategy

Despite being stationary, a Punisher possesses a speed of 25, allowing it to cast spells quickly and often. Though a Punisher cannot [regenerate](/wiki/Regenerate "Regenerate") [HP](/wiki/HP "HP"), they possess a stellar AC of -15 and a staggering [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)") of 95, rendering them near-immune to a majority of spells and effects. Punishers also cannot be killed with most instadeath attacks, and are overall troublesome to kill in straight-up combat - all but the most adventurous and daring of players are better off avoiding Punishers where possible.

You can [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") yourself if you have [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") and scan the level for a Punisher, then [dig](/wiki/Dig "Dig") or melt the [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") to craft an ideal path around its position. A source of [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") or [flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying") is advisable in the event a fire-breathing [dragon](/wiki/Dragon#UnNetHack "Dragon") or a monster with a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") is summoned, which could lead to [an unceremonious death](/wiki/YASD "YASD") if ice is melted from under you.

## Encyclopedia entry

Former wizards of the dark pits, the Punishers are immortal  
statues of great magical abilities. Their most feared  
ability is to conjure up a big, ugly and rusty iron ball  
that is chained around adventurers; adding to the heaviness  
of their duties.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 202; a comment mentions reports of Punishers filling an entire level with monsters](https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/316ce5ddc6eac7672db4337755ef893e84999048/src/mcastu.c#L202)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 611](https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/316ce5ddc6eac7672db4337755ef893e84999048/src/mcastu.c#L611)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 923](https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/316ce5ddc6eac7672db4337755ef893e84999048/src/mcastu.c#L923)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Punisher

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
` Punisher (No tile)
Difficulty ?
Attacks Spellcasting 0d0 punisher
` Punisher (No tile)
Difficulty ?
Attacks

Spellcasting 0d0 punisher

Base level 24
Base experience ?
Speed 25
Base AC -15
Base MR 95
Alignment 15 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 1500
Nutritional value 500
Size Large
Resistances poison, fire, cold, shock, sleep, disintegration, petrification
Resistances conveyed None

A Punisher:

  • does not breathe.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • has a thick hide.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • has infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • does not naturally regenerate HP.
  • does not move.

The Punisher is a type of monster that appears in UnNetHack. Punishers are the only members of the "statue" monster class, `, which uses the same glyph as ordinary statues and boulders.

Punishers are stationary, but can cast powerful monster spell from a unique spell set that contains a selection of mage and clerical spells, with weighting to avoid repeated casting of summon nasties[1] Punishers can also cast a unique melee-range spell that attaches an iron ball to the player as with a scroll of punishment. [2][3] A Punisher possesses all forms of elemental resistance, except for acid resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Encyclopedia entry
  • 4 References

Generation

Punishers only appear in Sheol: upon level creation for each non-fixed floor in the branch, there is a 1⁄2 chance of a Punisher being created. A Punisher can also be created by reading a cursed or uncursed scroll of punishment while confused.

A Punisher will always generate as hostile, and is not a valid form for polymorph.

Strategy

Despite being stationary, a Punisher possesses a speed of 25, allowing it to cast spells quickly and often. Though a Punisher cannot regenerate HP, they possess a stellar AC of -15 and a staggering MR score of 95, rendering them near-immune to a majority of spells and effects. Punishers also cannot be killed with most instadeath attacks, and are overall troublesome to kill in straight-up combat - all but the most adventurous and daring of players are better off avoiding Punishers where possible.

You can blind yourself if you have telepathy and scan the level for a Punisher, then dig or melt the ice to craft an ideal path around its position. A source of levitation or flying is advisable in the event a fire-breathing dragon or a monster with a wand of fire is summoned, which could lead to an unceremonious death if ice is melted from under you.

Encyclopedia entry

Former wizards of the dark pits, the Punishers are immortal
statues of great magical abilities. Their most feared
ability is to conjure up a big, ugly and rusty iron ball
that is chained around adventurers; adding to the heaviness
of their duties.

References

  1. ↑ UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 202; a comment mentions reports of Punishers filling an entire level with monsters
  2. ↑ UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 611
  3. ↑ UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 923

The '''Punisher''' is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[UnNetHack]]. Punishers are the only members of the "statue" [[monster class]], {{white|`}}, which uses the same glyph as ordinary [[statue]]s and [[boulder]]s.

Punishers are stationary, but can cast powerful [[monster spell]] from a unique spell set that contains a selection of mage and clerical spells, with weighting to avoid repeated casting of [[summon nasties]]<ref>[https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/316ce5ddc6eac7672db4337755ef893e84999048/src/mcastu.c#L202 UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 202; a comment mentions reports of Punishers filling an entire level with monsters]</ref> Punishers can also cast a unique melee-range spell that attaches an [[iron ball]] to the player as with a [[scroll of punishment]]. <ref>[https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/316ce5ddc6eac7672db4337755ef893e84999048/src/mcastu.c#L611 UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 611]</ref><ref>[https://github.com/UnNetHack/UnNetHack/blob/316ce5ddc6eac7672db4337755ef893e84999048/src/mcastu.c#L923 UnNetHack 6 src/mcast.u, line 923]</ref> A Punisher possesses all forms of elemental [[resistance]], except for [[acid resistance]].

==Generation==
Punishers only appear in [[Sheol]]: upon level creation for each non-fixed floor in the branch, there is a {{frac|2}} chance of a Punisher being created. A Punisher can also be created by reading a cursed or uncursed scroll of punishment while confused.

A Punisher will always generate as hostile, and is not a valid form for [[polymorph]]. 

==Strategy==
Despite being stationary, a Punisher possesses a speed of 25, allowing it to cast spells quickly and often. Though a Punisher cannot [[regenerate]] [[HP]], they possess a stellar AC of -15 and a staggering [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]] of 95, rendering them near-immune to a majority of spells and effects. Punishers also cannot be killed with most instadeath attacks, and are overall troublesome to kill in straight-up combat - all but the most adventurous and daring of players are better off avoiding Punishers where possible.

You can [[blind]] yourself if you have [[telepathy]] and scan the level for a Punisher, then [[dig]] or melt the [[ice]] to craft an ideal path around its position. A source of [[levitation]] or [[flying]] is advisable in the event a fire-breathing [[Dragon#UnNetHack|dragon]] or a monster with a [[wand of fire]] is summoned, which could lead to [[YASD|an unceremonious death]] if ice is melted from under you.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{Encyclopedia|
        Former wizards of the dark pits, the Punishers are immortal
	statues of great magical abilities. Their most feared
	ability is to conjure up a big, ugly and rusty iron ball
	that is chained around adventurers; adding to the heaviness
	of their duties.
}}
